intro: Cheiranthus alpestris, commonly known as the alpine mustards, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, bright yellow or white flowers and is often found in alpine and rocky habitats. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions across Europe, Asia, and North America. It has a compact growth habit with hairy leaves and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Cheiranthus alpestris is an important component of alpine ecosystems and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
